Description: Funerary papyrus of Pakharenkhons Pawerem; sheet 1; Hieratic text in red and black ink.
Curator's comments: The papyrus yields 4 compositions in 37 columns. This sheet contains the Glorifications (II) Bibliography: Bommas, ZAS 131 (2004), 95-113. The glorifications are published in J. Assmann et al. Altaegyptische Totenliturgien III Osirisliturgien in Papyri der Spaetzeit (Heidelberg 2008). Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 202.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (189)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57776) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57776)
Gill 2019a / The hieratic ritual books of Pawerem (P. BM EA 10252 and P. BM EA 10081) from the late 4th century BC (including acquisition history on pp. 5-7)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, fractured, loss Black ink Red ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
